class.name: XmlConfig
class.brief: Use xml formatted config files easily in projects
class.doc: Provides a high-level interface for xml formatted configuration files.

constructor.name: XmlConfig
constructor.brief: Creates an XmlConfig from the given xml file
constructor.doc: Loads the file, parses its content and makes its data available

argument.name: filename
argument.doc: The file containg valid xml to load

constructor.name: XmlConfig
constructor.doc: Copies maps to new object, it is now an effective copy of the original config

method.name: attributeName
method.brief: Get the attribute name from a full path
method.doc: Extracts the attribute name from a full node path. For instance: The node path "category.sub.a:name" yields "name"

return.doc: The attribute name if the path contains one. Empty string otherwise

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

method.name: attributesOf
method.brief: Get the attributes of a node
method.doc: One path is added for each attribute of the given node or an empty list if no attributes are present. Use attributeName( attributePath ) to get only the attribute name from the full path.

return.doc: Vector of strings containg paths to each attribute

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

method.name: basePath
method.brief: Gets the base path from a node path

return.doc: the path to the base node

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

method.name: childrenOf
method.brief: Lists the children of a node
method.doc: Gets a list of paths to all children of a given node. Very useful for automating tasks, building lots of objects, etc.

return.doc: Vector of strings containg paths to each node or attribute

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: depth
argument.doc: The number of levels to search for children

argument.name: attrs
argument.doc: Show Attributes of node and children or not

method.name: childrenOf
method.brief: Lists the children of a node selecting only a given tag
method.doc:
Gets a list of paths to all children of a given node of the given tagName type. Very useful for automating tasks, building lots of objects, etc.
Just a special case of the more general childrenOf(...)

return.doc: Vector of strings containg paths to each node or attribute

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: tagName
argument.doc: Filters children of the given tagName

argument.name: depth
argument.doc: depth to search - not yet implemented

method.name: cn
method.doc: Sets the current node so that relative node paths can be used

method.name: depthOf
method.brief: Determines the depth of a node
method.doc: Calulates the depth of the node from the root node

return.doc: the depth of the given node. Children of the root node have depth 0

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to Node

method.name: depthOf
method.brief: Calculates the depth of a node relative to another node

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node of interest

argument.name: relativeTo
argument.doc: The node whose depth is considered 0

method.name: exists
method.brief: Determine whether a node exists in the xml or not
method.doc: Searches the xml structure for the given node.

return.doc: **True** - node or attribute is found. **False** otherwise

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

method.name: getBool
method.brief: Gets a node or attribute as bool type
method.doc: Can be string of any case "true", or "false" Uses atoi(...) to convert string data to builtin type bool

return.doc: The underlying xml data at nodePath as an builtin type bool

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: def
argument.doc: Default value if the endpoint DNE or conversion to bool fails

method.name: getDouble
method.brief: Gets a node or attribute as double type
method.doc: Uses atof(...) to convert string data to builtin type double

return.doc: The underlying xml data at nodePath as an builtin type double

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: def
argument.doc: Default value if the endpoint DNE or conversion to double fails

method.name: getDoubleVector
method.brief: Gets a vector of doubles from a comma delimeted list

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: See getString(...) See getStringVector(...). Converts a comma separated list into a vector of double types. Uses atof(...) for string to double conversion.

method.name: getFloat
method.brief: Gets a node or attribute as foat type
method.doc: Uses atof(...) and cast to convert string data to builtin type foat

return.doc: The underlying xml data at nodePath as an builtin type foat

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: def
argument.doc: Default value if the endpoint DNE or conversion to foat fails

method.name: getInt
method.brief: Gets a node or attribute as integer data
method.doc: Uses atoi(...) to convert string data to builtin type int

return.doc: The underlying xml data at nodePath as an builtin type integer

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

argument.name: def
argument.doc: Default value if the endpoint DNE or conversion to int fails

method.name: getIntVector
method.brief: Gets a vector of integers from a comma delimeted list

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: See getString(...) See getStringVector(...). Converts a comma separated list into a vector of int types. Uses atoi(...) for string to int conversion.

method.name: getNodes
method.brief: Find nodes based on search criteria
method.doc:
Can be used to find nodes matching a conditions
**Case 1 )** Queries like : "group.node" returns a list of paths to all nodes of the form "group.node[0..N]"
**Case 2 )** Queries like : "group.node:name" returns a list of paths to all nodes of the form "group.node[0..N]" when they contain a "*name*" attribute
**Case 3 )** Queries like : "group.node:name=value" returns a list of paths to all nodes of the form "group.node[0..N]" when they contain a "*name*" attribute and it equals "*value*"

return.doc: A Vector of strings. One for each path to a node or attribute matching the query

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...). May also contain conditional parts. See description.

method.name: getString
method.brief: Gets xml node or attribute data as a string
method.doc: For an xml block like ``` xml <root> <data> <category> <cut1 name="cut1" /> </category> </data> </root> ``` The node "<cut1 />" can be accessed using the nodePath = "data.category.cut1" and its attribute can be accessed using the nodePath = "data.category.cut1:name"

return.doc: The underlying xml data at nodePath as a string

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: The path to the desired node from the root node. See examples below.

argument.name: def
argument.doc: **Default** = "" The value to return if the node or attribute is not found

method.name: getStringMap
method.brief: Gets a map<string, string> from a config node

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: See getString(...) Converts a node like : ``` xml <Map> from : to, alpha : beta </Map> ``` Into a map where map[ "from" ] = "to" and map[ "alpha" ] = "beta".

method.name: getStringVector
method.brief: Gets a vector of strings from a comma delimeter list

return.doc: A vector of strings or an empty vector if the node DNE

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString. Gets a vector from a comma delimeted list. For instance, if a node contains "1, 3, 9, 7, 16" then the vector whould contain 5 elements

method.name: join
method.brief: Joins two paths correctly

method.name: operator[]
method.brief: Same as getString(...) but with the [] operator.

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: See getString(...)

method.name: pathToParent
method.brief: Get the path to the parent of this node
method.doc: * @nodePath Path to node. See getString(...) * * Extracts the path to the parent of this node * For instnce: * The node path "category.sub.a" yields "category.sub" * * @return the path to the parent of given node

method.name: setDefaults
method.brief: Sets the default strings / delimeters

method.name: split
method.brief: Splits a string into pieces by the delimeter character

return.doc: A vector of strings, one for each piece after splitting on the delimeting character. If the delimeting character is not found a zero length Vector is returned.

argument.name: s
argument.doc: Input string to split

argument.name: delim
argument.doc: delimeting character

method.name: tagName
method.brief: Get just the tag name from a full path
method.doc: Extracts the name of the final node (tag name ) For instnce: The node path "category.sub.a" yields "a"

return.doc: the tag name of the node pointed to by nodePath

argument.name: nodePath
argument.doc: Path to node. See getString(...)

method.name: trim
method.brief: Trims characters off the front and back of strings

argument.name: str
argument.doc: Input string to trim

argument.name: whitespace
argument.doc: A string containing characters to trim. **Default** = " \t\n".

field.name: data
field.brief: data - map of node path to string representation

field.name: isAttribute
field.brief: does the nodepath point to an attribute value

field.name: attrDelim
field.brief: The delimiter used for attributes - Default is ":"

field.name: pathDelim
field.brief: The delimiter used for paths - Default is "."

field.name: equalDelim
field.brief: The delimeter used for equality - Default is '='

field.name: mapDelim
field.brief: The delimeter used for maps - Default is "::"

field.name: indexOpenDelim
field.brief: The delimeter for index open - Default is "["

field.name: indexCloseDelim
field.brief: The delimeter for index open - Default is "]"

field.name: currentNode
field.brief: Current node for relative path finding

typedef.name: map_it_type
typedef.brief: typedef of commonly used iterator for the class

method.name: addNode
method.brief: Adding content

method.name: manualToLower
method.brief: A manual case lowing function

method.name: sanitize
method.brief: Sanatizes node paths

method.name: split
method.brief: Splits strings using the given delim character

method.name: stringToPair
method.brief: A special case version of split used for the map decoding

method.name: vectorFromString
method.brief: Gets a vector from comma delimeted strings
